text: KRS 311216. Dark brown color with a beige head. Flavor is caramel, maple syrup, roasted malt, bacon, nuts, coffee, chocolate. Full body. Very nice beer.
The best porter Ive ever had with "No Rules" coming in a close second. The maple flavor and smell is amazing!

Bottle.

A- Maple syrup, candied bacon, subtle brown sugar, subtle molasses.

A- Black body, black liquid, light brown head.

T- Subtle bacon, maple, mild sweetness.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Again with these tasty porters from Funky Buddha. Seems like it should be a huge beer but its a tasty beer that hasnt been Imperialized and remains at less than 6.5%. Definitely lives up to the hype. I got loads of pure real maple flavor with a candied bacon secondarily that adds a light burnt brown sugar flavor without much umami. Somehow I didnt get much coffee. Im sure it helps balance things out but it didnt standout as a flavor that I detected. Somehow these all work well together yet shine on their own. What a tasty treat this was.

Bottle 650ml @ yngwie - 2016/17 new year tasting
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, toffee, coffee, molasses, chocolate, bacon and maple syrup.
Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, coffee, bacon and maple syrup finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

2017 bomber pours a dark brown black with a large khaki tan head. Sweet aroma of maple, caramel, toffee, with lighter coffee and roasted malts. Smooth and creamy on the palate, sweet flavors of milk chocolate, very present but not overbearing maple, vanilla, caramel mocha, a touch of salt, with light but distinct roasted smoky malt and coffee on the finish. Great balance of flavors, highly drinkable and delicious!!!

Bottle poured into a wineglass showing translucent coffee brown rims with spare white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of coffee and milk chocolate. 

The palate is medium bodied and porter carbonation, foamy body. Strong flavors of dry milk chocolate, caramel latte/mocha and maple syrup. Dry and a strong maple/latte finish.

Bottle 0,65 thanks to Slacker. Pours black with large off-white foamy head, good retention. Maple syrup, roasted malts, wood, chocolate, vanilla in the aroma. Maple is dominating in the taste, with notes of vanilla, chocolate, some smoke, faintly some salt. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle. Dark brown close to black with a large light brown head. Brown sugar, mild meaty smoke, chalk, dark wood and mild coffee in the nose. The flavour is mild with vanilla, light coffee, mild meaty smoke, maple syrup, dark wood, light tobacco. Medium body, soft texture, medium sweet and bitter. Long finish. Pleasant.

2017 draft pour at Frank N Steins. Pours a really dark brown color and topped by a small layer of tan colored foam that shows good retention before slowly settling to a thin film and leaving streaks of lace on the glass. The aroma is nice showing notes of fresh maple syrup, roasted coffee, chocolate, vanilla, and some smoked meats to go with the dark caramel and roasted malts. The flavor follows suit and shows a nice blend between the rich maple syrup, roasted coffee, chocolate, and salty smokey bacon flavors. There is just enough roast there to add some nice bitterness while a touch of vanilla adds depth and balance as well. Medium bodied and smooth with balanced carbonation that leads to a lengthy maple syrup and roasted coffee finish. This is still a tasty beer even after all these years and scaling up the production drastically.

Dark beer with some mahogany highlights. Thin beige head. Initial maple frosting nose that settled into a nice sweet coffee. Rich flavor of sweetened coffee, maple doughnut frosting, and a little smoke in the finish. Damn nice beer.

Bomber via FB trade. Poured a rather full body for only a 6.4% beer, under a smaller super tight foamy beige head. Aroma is sweet maple syrup topped French toast, coffee with a splash of cream. Flavor is more like maple syrup over lightly burnt toast with just a touch of coffee in the background. Thinner body for all the flavors in this beer with softer carbonation. So much going on for only a 6.4% beer, really nice.

On tap at Lost and Found, pours a muddy black with a ring of tan head. Nose is everything promised, maple, vanilla, coffee grounds, chocolate, some salty jerky. Flavor is better, WOW, chocolate covered espresso bean, maple, vanilla, no bacon but who cares. Finishes dry. So legit. I love to hate on hyped beers that dont live up, but this one absolutely does.

Bottle shared by Kyle, thanks! Pours near black with a brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a strong maple note with light roast, coffee and a hint of bacon underlying. Flavor has lots of maple with coffee underlying and some dark grains/roasted malts.

Tap at lost and found. Pours black some head and tons of lacing. Nose is big maple, marshmallow. Flavours of maple marshmallow roast, some bacon. Taste med bitter huge sweet. Creamy body lively carbonation.

Bottle from homer321-thanks! Enjoyed at an unofficial work ski day at Arapahoe Basin. Dark black with thick head. Nose is maple, smoked bacon, dark roast and dark chocolate malts. Taste is off dry. Flavors of dark roast malts, smokey bacon, maple syrup, vanilla. Very smooth and balanced. Very rich for this ABV. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Bottled. 2017 vintage. Pours black, big tan head. Aroma is really nice maple syrup, plenty of roasted coffee, chocolate, little bacony grease, and smoke. Smells like waffle crisp cereal, really awesome. That maple syrup comes through perfectly. Flavor is maple syrup, roasted coffee, chocolate, little. Smokey, some more of that greasy salty bacon, little bit of pepper spice. all so balanced. Soft mouthfeel without being too thin but would prefer if this was closer to 10%. Flavor is perfect basically but the mouthfeel is just too thin. Really damn good overall.

Bottle via trade, shared at Matty Os leaving tasting. It pours jet black with a thick light tan head. The aroma is is insanely rich and sweet, massive maple syrup character which dominates, toasty, smoked character, chocolate, treacle and a touch of coffee. The taste is slick, rich, toasty grain, roasted malt, coffee, creamy, maple glazed donuts, cookie dough and smoke action with a slick, sweet finish. Medium - full body and fine carbonation. Ludicrous stuff. Thankfully taste is not actually as sweet as the aroma would suggest. Pretty much America in a bottle. Tasty in small doses, but wouldnt want to chug the whole bottle. Fun stuff.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Pours dark brown, almost black opaque with foamy long lasting light brown head. Aroma -flavors are without contest: intesne slightly sticky maple, perfectly blended with coffee, chocolate, roasted, toasted toffee, hint of peat, hint of dark fruits esters...finish is slightly sticky dry. Body is medium, texture velvetly smooth, almost creamy, carbonation is moderate.

#2 porter in the world, and I can see why. Possibly the best Ive ever had!
Deep brown pour with smooth tan head. Aroma and flavor are so expertly balance between maple and coffee especially, with lighter roast, caramel and bacon in the background. Exquisite flavor and nose. Body was sooooo smooth and robust for a 6% beer. I see why FB is seen as the best at brewing beers that taste like other things. This was a masterpiece.

Bottle split at RBWG 16 hotel lobby share, thanks to Homer Eine Zwei Drei, 01/02/16. 
Black with a well appointed tan covering that retains well.
Nose is chocolate, spice, maple syrup, popcorn, light smoked bacon and malt.

Medium + body, oily feel, light booze tickle at the curtain call.

My Bottom Line:
Liquid smoke, caramelized syrup and portentous vanilla explode from this syrupy concoction, tainting the oesophagus for hours.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the dark brown mist.
-I was sooo ready to like this. Even had it for Halloween to be in the proper sugary mood. But this is NOT real smoke in here. It is certainly NOT maple syrup either (unless they tapped a telephone pole that was once a maple tree). This tastes as fake as most of the candies in my daughters pumpkin-shaped basket.
-The roasty bitterness in the back is a tad ashy.
-The Porter base is overwhelmed by the adjuncts. Malt flavors are few and far between.
-Coffee is rather muted compared to the rest.
-Drinkability is lower than that of the sweetest Imperial Stouts out there.
-If you are looking for something that doesnt taste like beer at all, and have a sweet tooth, this might be for you though.
-The end product is clean. But is so sweet and artificial that I cant support it. Give me any richly malty Imperial Stout over this any day.
-Funky Buddha can do a lot better than this.

2016 bottle via Homer321, thanks! Pours a brown to black with small tan head. Aroma is breakfast when you have pancakes and maple syrup. Taste is again maple and vanilla forward with some coffee. I get a very mild smoke at the finish. A little thin but the abv is nice.

text: Pours almost black with a thin head that lingers. Nose is like maple soaked pancakes with a side of bacon. Upon sipping, youre hit with an explosion of rich, bitter espresso. Breakfast in a bottle! Love it!

Pours a jet black. Aromas of espresso/chocolate, maple bourbon hints and roasted malts. Taste jumps out with dark roasted coffee and bittersweet chocolate malt with a nice bitter bite. Finishes with a sweet tail...

Intense, complex, and incredibly sessionable, this packs in the flavor as the name suggests. Concentrated flavors of maple syrup, smokey bacon and creamy mocha bean are expressive as can be and linger long through the finish above sweet toffee malt flavors.

Opaque black with a small, tan head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, maple, brown sugar, coffee. Taste of roast, coffee, maple, some brown sugar, smoke, and chocolate.

Bottle in a taster. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee, maple and bacon as stated plus a nice porter base under it. Flavorful and all the flavors work and its sweet and awesome. Smooth texture. A very cool beer.

Enjoyed this one at Dougs house on March 30 as part of an IPA tasting that spiraled out. 22 oz bottle. The pour is nice and light black with some garnet shining through and a light tan film of head that recedes to a collar. The aroma is a little boozy, but has lots of maple and coffee. The coffee is the resounding aroma up front with a sweet maple and a nice roast that lingers through. Im a little surprised at how much alcohol is present. The maple is a little subdued, but very good. The flavors are big coffee up front with a lot of maple on the back end. There is a hint of smokiness on the back that makes it nice. For a beer that is older, I cant believe how well the maple is blasting through. Its really good. The mouth feel is a little thin and carries a real nice carbonation and a lingeringly boozy maple aftertaste. Its pretty damn good. Funky Buddha Great stuff.
Oh hell yea thiis is good. Smells exactly like bacon.. Smokey bacon. Very sweet. Lots of maple. This is named spot on.....maple and bacon. Thx homer321.
Bottle...Pour is black with a nice tan head..Nose is coffee, chocolate, pancakes, fudge, some roast..Taste is maple, roast, sticky, oily, nutty, pancakes, coffee, some smokeness..

Bottle at amazing tasting 30th birthday of Alexander. Many thanks again!
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable head.
NOSE: fruity, chocolate, coffee, bit sweet.
TASTE: rather sweet, fruity, mocha.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to Brian Parker! 
Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head. Aroma is tons of maple syrup! coffee, roasted malt, light smokiness, vanilla and oak. The maple syrup is very dominating. Flavour is medium bitter and heavy sweet, 
Full bodied, rather thin texture, soft carbonation. Finish is maple syrup, very sweet, roasted bitterness and light salty.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Black. Roast, chocolate, light smokiness, vanilla, sweet, nuts. Medium-bodied. Very good.

Sampled during RBWG Tampa 2015. Brown pour with a small tan head. Nose is complex, engaging. Bright espresso. Sweet shocks of maple nut bar. Some vanilla. Rocky road fudge. Flavor is similar but with a nice smoked malt element. Glazed donut. Great harmony between what could be an overpowering, unruly set of flavors. Full body, supple. Oily.

Smells like breakfast -- maple, bacon, sweet marshmallow latte, maple donuts, nutty coffee and toast. Dear lord. Theres more smokiness in the flavor, along with peanutty roasted malts. Medium roast coffee, moderately bitter cacao, soft vanilla, buttery bread. Lingering coffee bean roastiness. Dry, soft finish is surprising and welcome. A really well-done blend on the flavors, while maintaining drinkability. Fantastic.

22 ounces bottle from trade with Jason. Aroma: really like this blend of maple syrup, bacon, coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Really subtle smoked as it warms up. App: dark brown, medium frothy moka head and great lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, light to medium sweetness, smooth, really subtle bitter finish. Overall: really enjoy this aroma, taste and smoothness. On the other hand the body feels too weak, too thin. With a bigger body and maybe a higher abv, I would have given a better rating for sure for the palate. I guess this is what Morning Wood is all about. Anyway, this is really really good.

Had this beer a few times but havent rated it. Dark brown near black pour with light head. Aroma is coffee, maple, nutty, and light smokey. Taste is rich sweetness and a lot of it but tasty nonetheless. A bit thin but overall cool.

22oz bottle pours black brown with small dark tan head. Nose is a sweet coffee syrup bomb, maple and sugary chocolate. Taste is sweet with a lot of cheap maple syrup, coffee and creamer, chocolate, light vanilla and some bitter roast. Finishes bitter and sweet with lingering sticky maple, coffee, just a bit over the top. Not much "bacon" or smoke notes. Body was slighty on the thinner side. Smelled amazing initially but over the course of drinking whole glass the novelty wore off and it was just an ok-good beer, not a great beer. Definitely a flavor bomb though.

Bleh. Pours a thick creamy burnt umber color. So much artificially flavored coffee going on here... taste like I poured a couple of flavored coffee creamers over a pile of styrofoamed packed pancakes and aunt jemima corn syrup and dug in. Im not a complete adjunct beer hater but some examples are just way to heavy handed and this one is right up there with those. Pass.
Drank @ Borefts 2015 (friday), thanks for the bottle sharing! Liked this one. Very soft, coffee is very pleasant. Very much taste for such a low-alcohol beer.

bomber bottle shared at borefts 15. poured an almost black colour with a nice tanned looking head on top. nose has strong roasted coffee beans upfront, dark roasted chocolate, sweet molasses, smoked bacon, caramel, and charred oak. flavor is fairly sweet but it goes over to a strong bitter aftertaste. lots of chocolate fudge. its my second low abv beer from funky buddha and its incredible to see how much flavor they can get in their low abv beers. its even just as thick as a 9% beer. incredible!

Pours clear dark brown with a beige head that settles in a foam ring along the curb of the glass. Nose: maple syrup is there, bacon is there and the coffee is definitely there. Cant ask for more than that. So; rauchmaltz, a sweet maple influence , chocolate, coffeegrounds. One of the best noses ive come across forever. Taste: it surprises me how full bodied this is compared to Last Snow. Good roasty richness and not as synthetic and vulgar as one could fear. Only some sweetness, light licorice and lots of well integrated coffee. The aftertaste is lasting and drying with dark chocolate, nuts and coffee. 
I put a little extra maple syrup in the last couple of sips and it didnt get worse let me tell ya that. Try it, it works. From now on Im putting maple syrup in all my porters, fuck dat. 
Big thanks to motherbrother for coming through with this floridian monster.

Black, tan head. Aroma of coffee, caramel, roasted malts and maple syrup. Quite sweet flavour, coffee, smoke, ash, caramel, roasted malts, chocolate. Finish chocolate, ash, coffee and maple.(from bottle @ THT: Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist Tasting. Thanks for sharing!)

Been wanting to try this for a long time, So thanks a lot to the german pusher for pushing this. Thanks Stephan. 
Pour an opaque very dark brown, not black though, with a small tan head. 
So much going on in the nose its kwaisii.... Maple, roasted coffee, bounty bar, roasted malts, salty and smoked goodness, fresh beans, taste is slightly sweet with a nice n roasted bitterness. Surprisingly full (its not full tho) bodied, with a lively carbonation. Man... I like this. I like it a lot.

Bottle at THT. Black with barely any head. Lots of coffee, maple syrup, sweet chocolate, slight mineral, roasted nuts and grains with soft brown sugar. Medium sweet with roasted bitter finish. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at THT tasting. Brown pour. Aroma of maple syrup, roasted malts, sugary malts, caramel and a hint of smoked bacon. Flavor is quite sweet, roasted, caramel and some spices. Very clean and a lovely balance.

Sample at the THT September
Thin creamy off white head. Huge coffee aroma. Subtle bacon and maple.

Sampled from bottle @ Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist tasting. Opaque black color, average sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, huge coffee, maple, vanilla, chocolate, bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Nice one!

Un liquide brun. Un nez de bacon fumée avec une masse de sirop dérable. Des biscuits feuille dérable et des outils. Une bouche mince, légèrement acide avec des saveurs salées de chocolat au sirop dérable. Perplexe je le suis.

Un liquide presque noir avec un anneau de mousse. Un nez fantastique et complexe. Ça sent littéralement le déjeuner du bûcheron canadien. La montagne de crêpes de Ti-Jean dans sa cabane en bois rond et le grain de café fraichement moulu. Au goût, cest moins impressionnant. Les saveurs sont moins bien définies. En bouche, le corps du porter est moyen-mince tandis que son pétillement est modéré et sa texture très légèrement huileuse. En finale, cest amer par le café.
Extremely tasty and full flavored, but still easy drinking. Very well integrated complex flavors; ones of the best non barrel aged porters out there.
Excellent brew from the Buddha as usual. A great brew by a bunch of great people.

650ml bottle from trade with RobertDale. Thank you Bob! Dark brown to black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, spicy - nutmeg, light hoppy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full almost creamy body with soft carbonation.

Sample at EBF 2015
Pours very dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is of extreme "artificial" maple syrup, coffee, caramel, butterscotch.Taste is of "artificial" maple syrup, molasses, some bitterness. Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: Nice.

THANKS to omgrich for sharing this one! 660 ml. bottle split by four. Black, small mocha head. Nose is big on roasted coffee & huge on maple down to the point of almost seeming artificial, syrupy with candy, light molasses, brown sugar, not really getting the bacon. Some light smoke behind the syrup & maple, maybe. Taste is maple, big viscous, sweet & syrupy, coffee, light roast, vanilla, thick sweet spices, huge additives giving it a rather artificial feel & taste, chocolate, sweet candy, some molasses, maybe faint umami & smoke in the back. Artificial / syrupy body. Far more odd than my description sounds, quite interesting & entertaining.
Black body with a light brown head. Aromas of coffee and sine smoke. Taste is a little sweet with caramel and honey, some smoke and coffee at the end. Medium body with low carbonation.

Bottleshare thanks to homer. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is amazing maple syrup, some coffee. Taste is more coffee forward, some syrup aftertaste. Mouthfeel is nice and light, maybe a tad thin, but really good. I like this more than I thought I would.
Black body with a small offwhite head. Maple syrup, roasted coffee, caramel, "labre larver", smoke, chocolate. Complex and delicious.

Bottle @ Very Warm Random Summer - Whalez Tasting with Hallinghansen. Pours black with a small creamy beige head and lacings. Very well rounded. Soft and smooth. Hazel, vanilla , chocolate, brun lagermands, maple, coffee and mild smoke. Subdued and very very soft. Solid sipper slash quaffer actually.

15 vintage

Pours a black color, turning dark red at the edge of the glass, with a decent beige, bubbly head.

Has an intriguing nose, featuring toffee, bready malts, cold pressed coffee, raisins, old, slightly skunky wood, and a whiff of syrup, together with salt. Smells complex in comparison to its lighter body, tied together by bakers chocolate. Not what I would expect from a porter, but quite unique and very pleasant.

Has a fitting medium carbonation among a lighter body, leaving a lot of room on the palate for bready coffee.

As well as the nose comes together, regarding its complexity, the taste is rather one-dimensional and thin. It exhibits raisins, toasty malts and an extreme overload of cold pressed coffee, rolling over all the other possible flavors, hindering the beer from developing more subtle notes, as featured in the aromas. The coffee though isnt very pleasant on the tongue, it includes no cream, but cold ash and a metallic, distracting flaw. Developes an unpleasant mix of metal, cold coffee and sticky sweet malts in the finish, leaving back a nice flavour of roasty hazelnuts at the very back end of the palate. 

Tastes more like a stout than an actual porter, due to its incredibly dominant coffee presence, opening the tongue to roast and earth, as well as old tobacco and cold ash unfortunately. Its sudden turn into a sweeter direction during the finish seems a little off, as it gets unpleasantly introduced by a bubbly, metallic carbonation, rather than more fitting cream or chocolate - basically plays both ends against the middle. Evokes an overall colder appearance, leading back to the coffee, while especially the maple syrup should be able to lend a certain warming quality to the beer - it does not, feels more like a gimmick than an actual necessary ingedient, forming the appearance of the taste.
Dark pour, brown head. Nice body, with coffe, bacon, maple, chocolate, biscuit. Really complex. Great beer
Bomber shared by Bvery....thanks man! Strong maple syrup, cocoa, malt aroma. Taste follow with some bitter malts at the end followed by the maple sweetness. Really well done. Glad I got to try this.

Bomber from 50belair. Damn, this is good! Dark brown pour with a light tan / gray head. Maple sweetness, dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Cool that this is a drier porter style instead of an ultra sweet boozy stout. Good balance. Terrific!

Bottle courtesy to hopscotch, thanks Eric! Pour is near-black with a 2 finger brown head that pillows nicely before settling to a cap. Aromas are nice coffee/chocolate with an underlying maple sweetness...vanilla notes and some notes of roasted nut. Taste is spectacular! Right up my alley! A nice medium-to-full bodied porter....dry chocolate coats the palate...coffee hit the bitter end...maple rounds it out. Very nice interplay...and great depth! The finish lingers for an eternity, allowing this to be sipped and enjoyed! Brown sugar, anise, toffee, coffee, salty smoke....it all just clings to your tongue. Wasnt sure if this would live up to its reputation, but it certainly does! Cheers!

Bottle from trade with knickskicks - thx Sir - cons 2015-05-12 Spring Hill, Fl
AR: fat rich milk chocolate, wee chili, 
AP: coffey black, high frothy thick lively cream brown foam
F: cajun smoked ribs with brown sugary glacé, milk chocolate, wee chili heat, sticky and maple sugary sweet mouth feel, finshes smoley meat with chocolate

EBF 2015. Pours a dark brown with a small beige head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of cheap maple syrup, 100% sure it is fake. Caramel and slight roast follow shortly. Taste is of cereals, nuts, roasted malt, some smoke and that artificial maple flavor again. Body is medium, carbonation too and mouthfeel is sticky. Fun to try and good but not the revelation I see in the other ratings. At least the maple syrup, while fake, doesnt overwhelm the beer.

This beer pours nearly black with a medium thick foamy tan head that diminishes gradually. Sticky patches of lacing on the glass. The aroma is a nice blend of roasted coffee, maple syrup and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of roasted coffee, maple-charred bacon and chocolate malt. The finish is roasty with smoked malt and mocha aftertaste. Really enjoyable beer all around.

sample @ EBF 2015. unclear dark brown mahogany with a small creamy light beige cap, some retention and lacing. brown malts, sweet nuts - nurnt caramel and hazelnuts, smoky - bacony-forward, medium bitter chocolate - minerals, freeze-dried coffee, relatively fresh coffee beans. light carbonation, medium body - oily, semi-sweet christmasy-spicy-nutty-coffee finish. good but not spectacular.

This beer is great. Figured I would hate it because of the smoke, but the smoke is subtle. The closest thing I have had to Mornin Delight, and I actually prefer this because I could actually drink more than a few oz without getting overwhelmed by sweetness. 

Aroma is great, rich sweet maple and hints of coffee. Flavor is first and foremost sweet, hints of smoke in the finish, some maple, a bit creamy. Body is thick but not viscous. 

Awesome.

I figured Id hate this novelty garbage but its pretty tasty and I think the brewer did exactly what they intended to so theres that going for it. This is a surprisingly big tasting beer, would have pinned it as an imperial stout based on flavor, which is of course mostly derived from adjuncts but still. Theres lots of maple and this does come off as sweet but not too terribly heavy. Theres lots of coffee and a slight bit of smoke. Its full bodied w/ medium, creamy carbonation. It is brown in color w/ a long lasting head. I dunno... this is not the kind of thing Id drink every day but if you brought it to a party and handed out tasters, everyone would be talking about it.
One of a large number of samples I had at the Extreme Beer Fest in Boston 3/21/32014. Beautiful Beer!
22 ounce bottle purchased at the brewery in Oakland Park, FL Excellent!!!
Bottle at Tasting, Seattle. Deep brown, big coffee aroma, sweet maple. A little vanilla. Cold, sweet, sharp. Medium body. Cold brew, syrup sweet. A little butterscotch. Thin minty finish.
Bottle at RBWG. Pretty great stuffbreakfast in a bottle. Poured black. Coffee, light bacon smoke, maple sweetness, some woodiness. Oily mouthfeel. Surprised it was only 6%. Awesome.

Rate #1000! January 2014 bottle shared with AirForceHops, Chalemaux and Amanda at home in my snooty drinking room. Pours nearly black with a beige head. I can already smell the maple and bacon as I pour this. Wow! Amazing aroma! Buckwheat pancakes with real maple syrup and a side of bacon. Breakfast is served! Flavor follows, but doesnt quite live up to the nose. Still a great brew. Plenty of maple sugar, a bit of bacon and dark coffee bitterness to finish. A great brew that I would never guess was over a year old if I hadnt cellared it myself.

Bottle thanks to Willrunforbeer. Great choice for his #1000th rate! Aroma is maple candy, sugar, coffee with cream and mild roast. Brian had this for a year and I would have NEVER has guessed it was a year old bottle. This stands the test of time. The flavor is huge coffee, maple sugar that has a oily (dare I say) bacon fat feel over the tongue. Gives a grease type feel for the essence bacon. Im no longer easily impressed, this did indeed impress me.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer for sharing your 1000th rate. Color is dark brown with a beige head with lingering legs. Aroma is awesome. Sweet maple sugar candy, espresso and mild smoke. Taste is wonderful with a smooth mouth feel. Coffe up front followed by hints of cocoa and maple syrup. No bitterness in the finish. Quite a spectacular beer for being 1 year old. Kudos!

Pours nearly black , clear , and no head . Scent is pure coffee , too much coffee . Taste is bit bitter , coffee, maple syrup sweetness ( which I like ) with a walnut-sidenote ( hmmm , reminds me a bit of kbbs ) I get the specification of Bacon as well , even though Id probably never said anything about bacon if it were not in the tittle . 
Very interesting beer .... I do not like the scent , but the taste is really good !

Excellent looking: dark red-brown with excellent clarity.
Not as great as the name suggests. 
O: kudos for managing to get maple, coffee and a hint of bacon into a porter.

2014 bomber. Mind-blowing aroma (easily one of the top five Ive ever rated) of a perfect balance of maple syrup, mocha espresso, and mild smoke in the background. Pours very dark brown. Refined taste of maple sugar candy that lingers forever, moderate coffee, chocolate milk, a hint of wood smoke, and butterscotch. Not a touch of bitterness in this incredible beer. Medium porter, but a thicker body than a bunch of stouts. What a treat; the nuanced balance of all the flavors is just delightful.
Have being a Funky Buddha member since the Original Funky Buddha Lounge & Brewery opened in Boca Raton 2010 this Beer never gets old. There is just simply nothing else like it.
Bottle thanks homer321. Deep black color with a nice tan head. Coffee and faint maple aroma. Taste is major coffee with some sweet maple. Not getting the bacon.

POURED 2014 BATCH from bottle to glass. Dark hue with fizzy brown head that dissipated to a ring. Aroma is maple, toffee, coffee, light smoke. Mouthfeel is nice with a full body and crisp Carbonation. Taste is sweet with a smoky finish. Overall this is a fun brew. POURED 2015 BATCH from bottle to glass. Dark hue with fizzy brown head that settled. Aroma is coffee, toffee, caramel, smoke. Mouthfeel is medium body with crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet with a smoky salty finish. Overall this is a nice brew.

Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a very dark brown with beige head that lasts. Incredible aroma is strong coffee and maple. Medium mouthfeel with strong maple, roast, bacon, lingering sweeteness, really enjoyed this one.
Very easy drinking and really nice dessert. This lives up to the hype. Stoked to try the imperial version at Huna day.

Bottle from trade. HUGE thanks for a long time want. Pours pretty much black with a creamy one finger khaki brown head. Beautiful aroma of smoke, chocolate, big maple syrup, coffee. Whoah. Flavor is big time maple syrup,big smokey bacon, coffee, light cocoa notes, roasty malts. Yep. Its all there. Medium bodied, creamy but not imperial stout heavy. Very easy drinking and really nice dessert. This lives up to the hype. Stoked to try the imperial version at Huna day.

Aroma is in your face no doubt maple syrup and coffee. Pours cola Brown with a medium tan head. Taste is coffee up front followed almost hesitantly by maple syrup that continues all the way to the sweet and bitter finish. The bacon seems hidden to me, but I can definitely get a pancake and coffee breakfast outa this one - AWESOME!

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Draft at MBCP. Pour is dark brown with reddish highlights.  Nose is mostly coffee, with moderate maple. Taste is amazing. A ton of maple, coffee works itself in there with just a touch of smoke. Lots of coffee as it warms. The real deal.

Funky stuff for sure, one of top 25 of draft mag...would think this is all overplace coffe and maple are so well balanced...either one of these could have funked this one up, but it did not. Each complex big flavor compliment each...great job!

This one poured a darker brown with a beige head. Aroma was huge maple, and some coffee and roast. Flavor similar, maple is definitely the biggest flavor, then coffee, and then only mild meaty Smokey Bacon

Bottle from a trade. Pours a dark clear brown with a light brown head. Aroma of huge maple, big coffee in the glass. Not too much bacon though. Aroma is amazing. Taste is bitter sweet. Really loving this stuff. Another hit from Funky Buddha.
Bottle shared thanks to artmcd8. Poured almost black with min beige head. Aroma strong with coffee maple and choc like a doughnut. Light carb med bod. Tastes like a doughnut maybe a lil bitter.

Poured from bomber into snifter. Medium head that quickly dissipated. Intoxicating aroma of maple syrup, smoke, and coffee. The flavor is really on point. At first it might seem weak compared to the aroma but anything more intense and the beer would come across more as a gimmick. Instead, it's balanced beautifully. There's a soft maple syrup presence that is never cloying or too much. If sits there and gently envelops the smoke and coffee. Don't be fooled, this is an easy drinking, excellent made beer. I could drink a ton of these.
Huge aroma of maple and coffee. Taste is heavy coffee and maple with a bit of bacon in there. This is definitely the best porter Ive ever had without a doubt.

22 oz. bottle via trade. Pours a deep opaque brown with a finger of tan head. Really nice looking. The aroma and flavor are mostly the same in notes and in character - maple on the initial and finish, dark chocolate, smoky pork (bacon), brown sugar, toast, and a shot of espresso in the middle. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a roasty mouthfeel that finishes sticky. Theres absolutely no balance in this at all in the nose or on the palate. Its like 1-2-3-4 in terms of picking out the individual elements. Theyre all really enjoyable, but certainly not blended together. Would that even be possible? I dont know, but Im wondering if Id like that version more or less because I liked all the pieces here. Fun beer.

Large brown head with good retention and little lace. Head settles into a thin sheet and just stays there. Black bodied brew. Maple aromas pop ya first then the heavily roasted coffee climbs outta there,hint metallic, nice. Body is med/full, bit chewy and nicely creamy and oily on the palate, almost silky, fine carbonation.Nice,dry,chewy, over roatsy coffee flavors, bittersweet chocolate, glancing maple notes, slight smoke (bacon?) caramel and some black malt notes. Dry finish is roasty tough and large with coffee. Man i love maple and this beer delivered. Blended nicely with the roasty coffee notes. Well done FB! No let down here. Many thanks to CraftCommander for hookin me up with a brew iv,e been hunting for for a while now. Thank Marco!

For everything this beer is worth its worth it all. It had roasted nose of plenty of char and maple. Bacon!! Flavor is more maple and bacon and roast and caramel and heavy. Sweet Christ almighty. Sweet Jesus... Sweet jesus...
Bottle pours black with tan head. Aroma is amazing maple and coffee. Taste is big coffee and maple chocolate, not much bacon. Great beer, need pancakes

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 Bomber, shared in line at R&D release. Lots of coffee a touch of maple and bacon do come through. And actual bacon, not smoke like some other bacon beers. Pretty good stuff, definitely legit. 


Fresh 2014 bomber. Smell is as good as it gets. Coffe and maple bomb. Taste is a bit light on the flavor, but I guess it is a regular porter.  Still very good. Crazy that Ive only had 3 beers from these guys but would easily put them in my top 10 breweries.
yeah, this is one of those beers you hope is all hype, but it really lives up to it.

Had this at a fantastic tasting and had such a great time with great people and great beers! This beer was the winner for me! The aroma will knock your socks off and the flavor backs it up! So thick its like drinking motor oil! LOVED IT!
Pours jet black with a thick mocha head. Aroma of big maple, smoke and coffee. Taste is smoke, maple, loads of coffee. Nice balance between flavors. Nice viscosity. Perfect!

Big maple nose on top of coffee and very light salty smoke. Dark brown almost black pour tan head. Flavors of lots of maple. Permeates throughout. Coffee and chocolate underneath. Very light salty smoke. Maple lingers. Good beer. A lot of damn maple. Smooth interesting unique.

30/VI/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: n/a, bottled: I/2014 (2014-683) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, small beige aery head, dissipates quickly. Aroma: sweet, lots of vanilla, sugary, caramel, some chocolate, mocha, sweet coffee. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: bit sweet, hint of vanilla, burned caramel, mocha, bit spicy, cinnamon, little smoky. Aftertaste: caramel, sweet mocha, bit sugary, pretty watery.

Bottle, RBAG 2014 prelim-- first beer of the day. Hearty very dark brown, sweet maple and dark malts, just a touch of meaty smoke. Dense flavours, rich and sweet but not cloying; mildly bitter finish. Maple is usually like honey for me when it comes to beer-- its hard to find a balance within the sweetness. But this beer does a fantastic job, very very good!

text:
Bottle to goblet at the RBAG14...first of the day at breakfast. Thanks kbudd.
Maple, bacon, coffee...just whats been advertised, I detect caramel and a touch of vanilla. Dark silky black with a creamy tan head. Taste is primarily maple and coffee and Im usually not a big maple in my beer kind of guy, but this works. Great beer.

RBAG breakfast beer! Bottle generously sent by my good friend Tommy, thanks man! Thick black pour, with light white foam. Aroma, coffee, lots of maple, chocolate, bacon, this a great smelling beer. Taste, subtle maple sweetness up front, followed by some coffee, creamy mouthfeel, with a sweet maple finish. This is delicious.
Bottle - Lots of sweet syrup, coffee and some light smoke. Jet black with a rich beige head. Coffee, maple and a bitter roast finish. I dont like maple, I like this. Really well done.

65cl, at 6.4%Vol, new exclusive American brew Anno 2010, with maple syrup and coffee, thx alot to Secret Santa!, complex sweet Porter, roasted/sweet and slightly fruity/smoked/malty, balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet very expensive!

650ml bottle. Brown pour, heavy maple and caramel smell, aslo some coffe and cocoa. Flavor is coffee, cooca, and maple, fairly dry surprisingly, no smoke really. Like the abv and not sure of the price point but it is probably expensive.

Flaska (från biggsbowler. Thanks!) Massiv choklad och möjligen lönnsirap 
Kjellander håller på traditionen och även denna midsommar slänger en skvätt över sig själv, i det här fallet vänster ben.
Känner ingen bacon. Balanserad rund och len. 
Kaffe men ganska låg beska. Kul eftersmak, troligen lönnsirap. Ja det är lönnsirap. Bacon är obefintlig. Upplevs ganska tung med tanke på abv. Bra som tusan! Midsommar 2014 i Nolsterby

650 ml bottle. Near black with tan head. Aroma of malt, rum, raisins, maple syrup, sugar, roasted notes and coffee beans. Taste is maple, roasted malt, coffee, vinous, raisins, a bit of rum and nice coffee notes.

22oz bottle thanks to Toby. Pours out a dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. Nose is great sweetness maple syrup roast malts and some coffee. Taste is as the nose with a nice roast sweetness maple for sure and some salt. I have been wanting to try this for a couple years.

Thanks to johngalt for this. Pours jet black almost no head. Nose is huge maple syrup. Tastes like a maple bar with a great coffee finish. The saltiness of the bacon is pretty subdued but still apparent. Nicely done

22 ounce bottle. Thanks to William! Pours almost black with a nice fluffy khaki head. Nice aroma of maple, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is maple, coffee, dark chocolate, a bit of vanilla, and a touch of caramel. Didnt get any bacon or smoke. This deserves its rating for sure. Glad they bottle this stuff so I have at least a chance to snag one every so often. Will try and have a bottle of this available all of the time.

Tap. Black body with a small, tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolat, toasted malt and bacon notes. Sweetflavor that ends up more dy an slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and flat to soft carb. A great Porter.

light beige head disappears quickly without lacing. coffee coloured. aroma ground coffee, candysugar and vanilla. taste like aroma, but lots of maplesyrup as well. medium body and carbonation. it is very sweet, but the flavours build up nicely. didnt get the bacon though. next time, ill bring pancakes ;) bottle 65cl

On tap. The aroma has intense maple syrup, a lot of coffee and a hint of smoke. Pleasant and really impressive aroma. The taste is also really heavy on the maple syrup taste - but without a cloying sweetness. It manages to catch the maple taste, and not all the sugar. Also coffee, caramel and roasted malts backed up by a light acidity. Couldnt drink a bomber of this, but a really pleasant and impressive beer.

Draft @ Mikkeller and friends. 
Sweet coffee aroma, caramel, cream, whisky. Like an Irish coffee. 
Black with tan tiny tan head. Virtually none lasting. 
Sharp coffee bitterness at first, high sweetness, light bitterness. 
Finish is bittersweet. Soapy texture. Light carbonation.

Nose is (sweet) English licorice, asphalt whiff, some wood chip, weak smoke, milk chocolate, then subtle maple syrup note, cane sugar, feel is quite broad, taste is gun powder, cola, cream note, then quite broad maple syrup,

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2014 (2x on tap and growler fill @ Mikkeller & Friends) The aroma of this one is insanely great even when poured at a too cold temperature at Mikkeller and Friends. I just love how the maple syrup, coffee and chocolate notes blend together into something that reminds me of great chocolate confectionary or perhaps an American breakfast. The smoke/bacon is not immediately obvious so I guess its quite subdued and perhaps it just blends into the overall aroma picture so well. The appearance is pitch black with a relatively small but intense toffee head that fades into a thick film with an even thicker lace ring. Tasting it yields an experience like drinking liquid confectionary although at the same time not cloying at all. Flavour is very close to the aroma, carbonation is soft, body is full yet lighter than the aroma would suggest. Finish is moderately sweet but balanced out by some more polyphenolic chocolate/coffee-roast bitterness. This is a well balanced masterpiece.

Draft. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of bacon, maple sirup, coffee, and chocolate. The flavor os sweet with notes of maple sirup, chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee, leading to a bitter finish. Pancakes and coffee in a glass - love it.

To be quite honest-Holly shit this beer is amazing. thanks be to my good buddy Topher , if not for him I would not have had the opportunity to sample, share, appreciate this beer. Poured into a Prairie tulip glass and it wastes not time asserting what it is. Phenomenal Maple, Pancake Sausage, McGriddle flavor aroma and boyd. No kidding this smells like a full plate of breakfast. Holy shit, I cannot express my pure pleasure while eating/Drinking this beer, it is simply breakfast. I want more, So much more!

As recommended, consumed at breakfast with a stack of chocolate chip pancakes. Pours a dark black with a surprising amount of carbonation. The aroma...oh, the aroma. Its all there: maple, bacon, and coffee, with the roast notes youd expect in a porter. The taste is the same, with maple sweetness dominating at the beginning and coffee bitterness at the end. The palate was a bit thin and fizzy for me. Overall, a fantastic beer. Perhaps this was just my own expectations, but I think Id rate this much lower if I drank it in the evening by itself. It would just be too sweet. But in the morning with breakfast, it was perfect.

Almost black. Big tan head. Some lacing. Huge maple glazed donut aroma with a hint of coffee. Huge maple taste. Like eating a maple glazed donut. Some coffee in the back. No bacon. No smoke. Very cloying.

Growler shared by jeffo, thanks man. Black pour with a nice tan head. Aroma is one of the most powerful aromas Ive ever gotten from a beer. Just opening the growler filled the room with an aroma of spices, curry, cinnamon, coffee and chili peppers. In the glass, the beer gave off woody aromas, rich dark chocolate, coffee and spices. Taste was spicy, curry and cocoa, not very sweet, nice bitterness. Palate was medium-light bodied with smooth carbonation.

Growler, shared by jeffo, thanks! Dark brown with a small persistent beige head and some lacing. Aroma is quite amazing as it is extremely powerful without being overwhelming. As soon as the growler was opened, the entire room was smelling like a restaurant during breakfast. The nose consist of maple syrup, meaty smoke presence (not exactly bacon, but close enough), fresh grounded coffee beans and roasted notes. Taste is also surprisingly flavorful for a 6.3 % abv beer with maple syrup (main flavor) along with meaty smoke, coffee beans, roasted malt, fudge, moderate sweetness and light bitterness. Body is a little less impressive as its not weak, but maybe a tad watery at times. Moderate carbonation. Im impressed by how tasty this can be considering the relatively "low" abv. And, surprisingly, the balance isnt bad either.

Growler shared at the 2014 tasting in the Cellar of Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles. Pours near black with a thick medium tan head. Aroma of strong roast coffee, light bacon crisps, caramel, smoked wood. Flavor is over moderate sweet and bitter. Massive fudge coming out in the palate along with spicy aspects. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Excellent!

Pours dark brown color with tan head. Aromas of coffee, roasted malts and maple. Sweet chocolate and moderately roasted malt flavors with coffee and a hint of sweet maple. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation.

Bottle shared by Dave. Aroma of maple syrup, coffee, and slight chocolate. Pours black with a small to medium brown head. Taste is sticky maple, almost a brandy, dark roasty coffee, and a nice chocolate malt back. Sticky taste but not a very thick mouthfeel. Nice roast on top of the sweet. Better than I expected and I had high hopes.

Dark brown, aroma has a lot of maple, quite a bit of coffee. Sweet coffee taste, subtle hint of maple, sweet chocolate, pretty good balance. Not the tire fire I was expecting. You really gotta like maple, as it comes out a lot and theres a ton of coffee late.

22 oz. bottle, pours black with a medium beige head. Aroma brings out loads of maple and coffee, maybe a touch of smoke as well. Flavour is amazing, with notes of coffee and maple upfront - not so much bacon or smoke. The maple is perhaps the most prominent flavour, finishing on the maple and a tiny bit of coffee. Wonderful stuff.
