Apperance: Dark brown with a beige/brown head.
Aroma: Coffee, Chocolate, Maple syrup.
Taste: Chocolate, Coffee, Bacon, Maply Syrup, Hint of caramel.
Palate: Medium carbonation and kind of rough/aggressive liquid.

I really dig this. A beer for breakfast if there ever was one!

Bottle with huge thanks to 50belair! Pours opaque black with a medium creamy brown head, dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is hella maple, very nice with coffee and roasted malt notes, perhaps a touch of dark chocolate. Flavor does not quite live up to the promise of the nose. Still quite good, medium sweet, light bitter, a touch of smoke perhaps. Lots of coffee, but the maple kind of turns the corner a bit to the artificial side after a while. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Super glad I got to try this one.

Bottle shared at Dunts Tasting (Chicago, IL). Pours a rich brownish black hue, well hazed with decent frothy brownish head atop. A bit bubbly, nice aromas start to throw firm toffee, maple and cocoa. Vanilla meets cocoa, some caramel and gentle smoke, bacon and earth. Initial is a firm body, sweeter cocoa and caramel anchor a decent smoke, a touch meaty with maple syrup, decent sweetness. Firm sticky body, some decent sticky vanilla and maple on the backend firms up the body. Some coffee grounds and roast, sweet caramel, vanilla and syrup. Some toast, sweetness, odd play. Big and assertive. Sweet, a bit sticky and big. Nice and strong.
Bottle shared with bytemesis, thanks! Black color, nice brown foam. Aroma of maple and coffee grounds. Roast coffee, ash, powder sugar, hint of maple. Nice roasty finish.

Bottle. Oh wow, this is amazing. The aroma is all sorts of good. Maple, bacon, coffee bomb. The taste is a little too carbonated, but perfection nonetheless. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
sample at extreme beer fest, sweet flavors, some coffee in there, medium body, soft carbonation. Would like to try a bigger sample.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Black. Aroma is maple but no bacon. Taste is medium carbonation - but too much for me and my porters. And the flavour is largely maple; its everywhere. No bacon. Overall, good, but far from a favourite porter. Not overly complex.
Pours pitch black great tanned creamy lacing head. Rich cocoa chocolate sweet vanilla roasted malt. Need to get more of this.

Bottle thanks to Mike (I think) for sharing. Pours black with a very small foamy head that lingers a bit. What an awesome aroma. Big maple and coffee with some light smoke and light roast. Tastes just as good. Again, huge maple and coffee flavor. Some nice lactose sweetness and a little salty, cured meat taste as well. Thin to medium body. Love the aroma and taste of this stuff. If they made a stout version of this with some more body, it could be up there with my favorites.

Bottle, sample pour  with thanks to gyberic. Aroma is deep, with layers of French pressed coffee, earth, sweet roasted coffee beans, mocha, vanilla, sticky maple syrup, and milk chocolate. I am not really picking up on any kind of bacon aroma perse, and I mean any kind of salinity or smoke. Aroma is pretty darn sweet and inviting though  like maple syrup covered pancakes (but less so than Mornin Delight). The beer is deep brown, almost black with minimal tan head. Taste follows aroma pretty closely with luscious milk chocolate and well integrated mocha. Big roasted coffee on the palate followed with sticky sweet maple, brown sugar. Some earth nuances as well probably from that bacon aspect, but still no smoke. Body is full, kind of syrupy with soft carbonation. After taste is mostly maple that lingers on the tongue for minutes and minutes. Overall a ridiculously luscious beer, but a bit on the sweeter side with a huge maple presence and brown sugar. The coffee and chocolate is mainly on the front end with maple on the back. I spilled a little on my hand during the pour, and my hand smelled like pancakes the rest of the night.

Bottle, shared by fsck -- thanks! Holy wow. Didnt really want to like this, but shit. Aroma is coffee, maple, and candied bacon, the kind that you roast in your oven that makes the whole house smell like heaven. One might expect it to be a cloyingly sweet aroma, but the coffee really cuts it off nicely. I dont really want to taste this, it smells so good. No, thats a lie, I do want to taste it. The taste is sweet, and though the coffee flavor on the end is great, it really lacks the roast/coffee bitterness Id hope for to balance it, leaving this awfully sweet overall. The body is thin, somewhat watery, lively carbonation. Theres loads of candy bar chocolate in this, and its impressive how much bacon comes into the flavor without this really being "smoky." Pretty cool beer overall.

Side note: glass needs to be thoroughly washed after drinking this, or else everything else smells like maple and bacon.  "Heh, interesting maple bacon aroma on this unblended lambic..."

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin! Deep, deep brown pour, nearly black with a huge, fluffy, foamy, light-khaki crema that sits quietly on top. Aroma is quite mind-blowing, as you can literally pick out all three elements in the beers namesake. It has a thick, oily & roasted coffee bean presence up front with a lighter & sweeter balance of maple syrup in the background that leads into a subtly smoky, campfire & meaty finish. Coffee, maple, & smoke, done elegantly & wonderfully. The taste is comprised strongly of a big, sweet maple syrup presence on top of a hefty dose of smoked malts. I get more of the charred campfire smoke than actual "meat" but the balance between the bitter smoke/roast & the sweet maple is quite nice. Coffee finally makes an appearance as it lingers with a bitter bean flavor in the aftertaste. Well balanced, & again, all three flavors represented on the palate nicely. I really loved this brew, it certainly didnt let me down. Tasted like a morning at the IHOP in beer form.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Bottle from a trade. Extremely unique beer. Very fresh coffee bean aroma. Literally has every flavor described. Nice bacon smokiness. Maple flavors really finish it nicely. Really good stuff.
Glad i got to try this. This beer smells awesome... Tons of Maple & Coffee, Taste exactly what the label says.. Roasted Coffee, Maple , little smokey, well balanced excellent beer.

Bottle from newcigarz. Aroma and flavor of maple-hinted coffee with some faint notes of bacon. I love porters like this: not thin, not 1-dimentional, and not boring. Good carb and retention, which added a ton in the nose. I was very happy to get to try this. It was an excellent beer.

Bomber to taster (shared by GAbell). Looks good; a translucent cola with tan lacing. Smells great! Just like the name suggests. Tastes like it smells, but not quite as robust. Good on the palate. Awesome beer!

Tap at brewery. Pours deep, dark brown with creamy tan head. Aroma is maple syrup, light roasted malts, light espresso, light spice, and faint bacon. Flavor is roast malts forward with coffee, chocolate, faint ash, maple sweetness, and faint dark fruit esters; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Draft at the brewery. Pours almost black with a fizzy light brown head. Tastes sweet, like maple syrup, roasted grains, some creamy coffee, and hickory smoke flavor. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet coffee beans and cocoa.

Aroma: Chocolate, Maple, Smokey

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Brown Head, Some Lacing

Taste: Maple, Chocolate, Smokey Bacon

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Smokey, Mildly Sweet

My brother gave me a 22 oz. bomber as a gift. Knowing i could trade this beer for almost any my heart desired I decided it was worthy of my keeping. Nice carbonation medium/ more twoards dark brown. Great maple/ coffee aroma. Beautiful espresso colored head. Medium to full body porter. A load of maple upfront coffee aftertaste malty backbone slight salty finish.

Dark brown, thin tan lacing. Maple syrup drenched pancakes with fresh roasted coffee, hints of vanilla and chocolate. Akin to KBBS and MD in aroma. Bitter black coffee in the taste. Smooth, viscous for a porter, and medium bodied. Lingering coffee finish.

Pour from a growler, big thanks to voodoofish65usf for fridging a couple ounces for me (it was probably in there for an hour before I was able to taste it). Clear brown color. Thin brown head, loose dots of lace. Amazing, huge maple, light bacony nose. Some nice, huge coffee. Absolutely awesome aroma. Despite it sitting for a bit, still some very light carbonation. Bigger body, more dry finish. Light to moderate sweet taste, good moderate bitter. Wow. Such an amazing aroma to this. Well worth the 30 minute journey on snowy roads. Delicious aroma.

Growler thanks to Luke. Pours a pure black color with a medium brown head. A massive nose of pure maple, light smoke. A somewhat thin body, smoke, toffee, some toasted malt, more huge sweet maple, even some ice cream. Quite interesting. Good.

From Matt. Thanks!

A: Fluffy, fuzz cappuccino head, stark black body, good legs.

N: Maple for miles. Cocoa, smoke, coffee. Bacons hidden underneath .

T: Smoke, char, sweetness together. Very donut like.

M: Medium body, slick, alcohol is hidden.

O: Impressive. Packs tons of flavor. Nose outpaces the palate a bit, but still quite good.

Black pou, tan head, nice legs. Nose is huge maple syrup and coffee, some chocolate, even a touch of peanut butter. Taste is maple syrup, fresh coffee, roasted malts, some chocolate. Sticky medium mouthfeel. Best porter Ive had by a wide margin.

This PORTER is in a flippy howler provided to me via Hopscotch and served in snifter: Pours a medium brown hue with a frothy beige head and okay lace. Wow what a fantastic aroma of maple syrup, meaty bacon, iced flavored coffee and some roast. The taste while forefront with the maple is not overly sweet, nice smoky and toasted character as well. Finish with light coffee bitterness. The mouth feel is lively and a tad dry. I touch thin bodied but It is a PORTER so that is to be expected. Overall I am digging this quite a bit but do wish it displayed a tad more smoky meat and coffee notes and a little less maple. Oh, in case you missed it, this is a PORTER

Growler via 50belair: &nbsp Black pour, thin to moderate sudsy beige head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Whoa, huge maple syrup aroma. &nbsp Smells like breakfast! &nbsp Some coffee as it warms, roasted malts as well. &nbsp Not getting much in the way of bacon, but this is intense! &nbsp Well balanced amounts of maple syrup, coffee, and roasted malts on the tongue. &nbsp Not as thick as I would have liked, but at 6.3% why would it be. &nbsp Lingering roasted malt finish, a touch of dark chocolate. &nbsp Gonna let this warm up a bit to see if the bacon comes out, but as its its whacky, well balanced, and tasty! &nbsp Bonus points for creativity! &nbsp Thanks Matt!

Sample at GABF - Made a b-line for Funky Buddha went I got to the fest and this was the first sample of the day. Aroma of blod and fresh coffee, with a nice wallop of maple. Taste revealed more of the smoky bacon flavor but is melded well with the chocolate, coffee and maple than I would imagine. different and tasty treat.

This one has eluded me for too long! Huge pop from the growler upon opening, gushing lightly. Unmistakeable maple bacon aroma lights up the room. Gimme some pancakes to go with this aroma, stat! 

Started off over-carbed, yet the viscous mouthfeel remained. A few minutes later brought mouthfeel nirvana. Bitterness from the coffee and milk chocolate balances well with the mildly smoked maple. Sweetness greets these flavors midway through before the porter yeast grabs the reigns, leading us to a dry finish. Taste is quite nice overall, yet remains a solid step behind the decadent aroma. 

Big fan of the Buddha, and while I *did* expect to be more impressed by this beer, it's only because my expectations are sky-high that they were barely missed. A fantastic brew, regardless, and I can't wait for more. <3 FB

UPDATED: APR 6, 2014 At thomas. Pours black with light lacing. Aroma is maple syrup, fatty bacon, chocolate, marshmallow. Taste is smooth maple, chocolate, watery, nice.

Additional rating at GABF 2013: Pours very dark black with grey medium sized head. Aroma is huge burst of flavors, huge bacon, some maple, roasted malt. Taste is roasted malt, sugar, syrup, molasses, caramel, finish is quick and little cleaner than I could like, the taste is a little thin and a little bit of a let down compared to the aroma. 4.1
Sampled at gabf. From my notes. pours a dark brown with a tan head. big maple and coffee aroma taste is the same. .its like breakfast in a glass
Sampled at GABF 2013. Dark brown, almost black, pour with a creamy tan head. Incredible aroma of maple and coffee. Rich chocolate, espresso, and maple flavor. An outstanding beer!
On tap at GABF 2013, pure maple syrup aroma with some great chocolate and coffee roast. Taste is spot on, great syrup taste.
Pours a dark brown tan lacing. Huge maple syrup nose with chocolate and coffee. Tastes like breakfast waffles and syrup. Medium bodied mouthfeel

Multiple pours at GABF. Pour is deep brown/black in appearance with a frothy brown head and great lacing. Huge maple syrup aroma - kind of ridiculous how much it smells like sweet maple syrup - big notes of coffee, earthiness, and deep roast, as well. Taste is very much like the smell - sweet maple syrup upfront, some vanilla, cocoa, a hint of smoke, brown sugar, and rich espresso with deep roastiness on the backend. Thick syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Literally smells amazing and has the taste to back it up. Like bourbon maple syrup covered pancakes with a side of fresh espresso. WOW! This was a treat and probably my favorite beer at GABF.

Tap at GABF. Oh this is a good one. Great nose of maple with a hint of smokiness. Each of the three flavors comes in its own way with the maple very subdued and mellow. This is a great beer and extremely drinkable.

750 ml bottle - kindly shared by FX Cannelle, sampled with Dennoman and Romain VeryNiceGuy at the pre-BBF13 tasting. Surprise of the evening! Pourse intensly black with light yellowy head. Complex aroma, more like a bouquet of mocca, coffee, roasted hazelnuts, caramel, butterscotch and toffee. Light body with a light sweetness in perfect balance with the roasty notes. Deep chocolate taste (bittersweet) with afternoon coffee alike taste. This is a great beer; such intensity of aroma and taste vs. the light body of the beer and such a looooong finish. Truly amazing. I never thought a porter could have so much depth and complexity.
Brown pour with creamy tan head and lace. Smokey, peaty, chocolate aroma. Large smoke, bacon, sweet abv warmth. A tad thin and watery. Good but different

Its a damn shame that more people dont get to try this beer, hell I live right near the brewery and have only had it on a couple of occasions.  It is just remarkable how well the bacon integrates with the maple sweetness without tasting like some Schlenkerla beer dipped inside a bottle of Dirty Bastard.  The coffee is what puts it over the top, sealing the deal as a well-rounded and nuanced beer with excellent aroma and great flavor.

Draft at Funky Buddha. Snifter. Pours a very dark porter with a mild tan head. The aroma is insane. Smoke, coffee, maple syrup, malts. The taste is even more insane. Ive had this a number of times and it is a little different each time. You really get the roasted malts first with smoky bacon. Then the soft sweetness of the maple syrup creates a moderate dry finish. The aftertaste is...well its breakfast!! Really is one of my favorite beers...certainly my favorite Porter.

Growler shared on the RBWG 2013 bus - a huge thanks to THE hopscotch. Pours clear brown with a light, tan cream head. Rich coffee in the nose. Medium to big sweet flavor, lots of rich and roasty malts, coffee, hints of maple syrup and smoked meat. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish, lots of dark malts, light smoke. Delicious stuff.
On tap at Funky Buddha. What an amazing beer. Coffee, smoke, caramel, and maple syrup. Chewy and thick with an amazing finish. I could drink this all the time.

Old rating from 2010 - growler - thanks jedwards. 

Appears near black with a loose tannish head. Only slight lacing.

The smell is huge. Coffee obviously, some coffee grounds, some chocolate, maple, a little smoke - A lot going on in the glass. Taste is rich coffee instantly the some chocolate, maple, smoke the other flavors join the orchestra.

The body is medium, mild carbonation. A smooth beer.

Overall very interesting and enjoyable. It should be tried if you get the opportunity.

wow- thanks to hopscotch for bringing this!! .. . pours a deep brown black .. . crazy aroma and taste- spot on maple, bacon, and coffee!! .. medium mouth .. sticky lingering finish .. ruins the glass, in a good way .. . amazing beer!! 

.. . . oh wait, that was on final jeopardy last night...

Thanks to hopscotch for sharing this at the RBWG.
Black pour, tan head.
Aroma of fresh roast coffee and maple candy.
Rich chocolate-coffee flavor profile.
Unique and tasty beer.

multiple 2oz samples on tap at brewvival 2013. super stoked to finally get the chance to try this in such a cool setting. not my typical eloquent rating as i was standing in 6in of mud and the pouring rain...

pours pitch black, velvety, and truly rich for an imperial porter/sweet stout with a dense, dark mocha head. aroma is wonderful with huge, fresh cofffee, roast, maple syrup, smoked meat, brown sugar, and toast. flavor follows suit but cranks everything up a notch with huge notes of sweet maple syrup, toasted waffles, espresso, and fresh bacon backed by lingering roast, smoke, and toffee. palate is rich, creamy, and perfectly carbonated. overall, a world class beer that deserves the hype.

Bottle shared at the RBWG welcome dinner 
Appearance Black with a small tan head and light lacing 
Aroma: Maple syrup and bacon 
Taste: Roasted malts, maple, meaty and mild smokiness 
Very nice, whats not to like about maple, bacon and coffee. Breakfast of champions.
dark brown. Good head. Really balanced coffee and maple in the aroma and flavor. A little sweet for heavy drinking, but a really beautiful beer. Great cooking potential.

Bottle thanks to hopscotch! Pours a hazy brown from the bottle with thin tan lacy head and no real lacing, but a nice film. Aroma of coffee and maple syrup, taste follows, sweet upfront, like candied bacon, then smokey at the end. Damn good for breakfast.

Unlabeled bomber shared by hopscotch.  Thanks Eric!  Nose is super potent sweeter dunkin donuts like coffee.  Flavor is similar, a little overly sweet, some cocoa, sweeter Mexican coffee.  Fun to try and much better than the rogue one.

Bottle at Dunderölsprovning 2012. Clear, deep brown liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of old coffee, maple syrup, light baby corn, biscuit, light smoke, toffee and some light bitter chocolate. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, maple, light ash and light caramel. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Ok, but quite weird. The coffee flavour just seems old.

Draft at Fermentation. First off, walking into the bar it smelled like a fucking IHOP. Black pour with a fluffy brown head. Nose is maple syrup, buttered pancakes, roasted malts, fresh pressed coffee, subtle smokiness and chocolate. Flavor maple syrup drenched pancakes, more noticeable smokiness, dark chocolate and French roast coffee. Sweet medium to heavy bodied with a sweet finish. Damn tasty beer.

Dark brown body, large off-white/pale tan head.  Spotty lacing.  Nose is full of coffee, syrup, chocolate and general roasted notes.  So far, so go.  Flavor, however, is overly sweet and malty.  Youd think the roast and smoke would help cut the flavor some, but alas, it doesnt work.  Full bodied, cloying sweetness, thick finish.

Growler shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

This very intriguing brew appears a dark brown shade, with crimson highlights apparent when held to the light. The head is about a quarter inch thick, and settles down to a thin layer atop the beer. The smell is just awesome. Wow! Scents of maple, vanilla, smoke, chocolate and a robust coffee presence make for a world class aroma. The taste does not disappoint, though it doesnt quite live up to the promises of the fabulous aroma. Fresh coffee and maple syrup are blended to perfection, with some chocolate and vanilla notes coming in behind. I actually thought this beer was higher in alcohol. Highly drinkable - I could sip this all night. In fact, thats what I did.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 02-12-2011

Served on-tap at the Hulmeville Inn during Philly Beer Week 2012. Just getting around to writing this one up.

A - Pours very dark brown, might as well be black, with a small half finger tall off white head leaving spotty streaks of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of a TON of maple syrup, fresh brewed coffee, smokey dark roasted malt and a touch of chocolate malt. The rauch character grows as it sits in the glass.

T - Starts off with plenty of intense maple syrup sweetness slowly giving way to hints of coffee, chocolate and some smokey rauch malt. The "bacon" isnt very noticeable initially but it does grow stronger throughout the experience. Finish is pretty sweet with some dark roast, lingering on the palate long after the finish.

M - Big, full body with intense flavors and moderate carbonation. For being so big and flavorful it is still has a very smooth feel. This one is definitely a sipper but in a great way.

O - On the way back from the bathroom I noticed that the entire bar smelled like maple syrup...pretty sure that isnt a coincidence. Other than possibly HF Ann this is the best beer I had during PBW this year. Amazing stuff.
More of a maple syrup beer, not much bacon, maybe smoked maple.  Pretty good palate, but flavor is definitely trendy and one is enough.

Bottle from notes (mid 2011).  Pours dark brown with a medium sized tan head.  The nose is exactly as advertised; sweet maple syrup, a nice meaty smoky quality and some roasted black coffee all working well together.  I could have easily stopped here and been happy.  Well lets give it a try since its here.  The flavor is sweet maple syrup and caramel, black coffee, roast with some ashy notes, a meaty smokiness.  Theres quite a bit going on and my only complaint is the body is not quite there to support everything to its fullest.   Otherwise,  a very solid beer.

Black pour little orange hue tan head ... aroma is overwhelmingly of maple syrup but also vanilla, caramel, light roasted coffee and dark chocolate .... taste is of maple syrup, chocolate, deep bitter roasted coffee and caramel malts (I did not really detect any bacon) ... mouthfeel is thick and syrupy ... finish is dry and of bitter dark roasted coffee and dark chocolate ... the aroma and taste of this beer are amazing

Draft at Churchkey for the Bluejacket/Funky Buddha/Cigar City event during SAVOR week. Poured a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Aroma is serious on the maple, with notes of coffee. Flavor is light coffee and chocolates with a bunch of smoked maple and bacon. Nice!

On tap at Woodys, pours a pitch black color with thin head and lacing. Aromas and taste of roated and strong columbian coffee, maple syrup, very light bacon, cocoa nibs. Another solid brew from Funky.

On tap at the Hulmeville Inn.  Dark brown with minimal froth.  Nose is big maple, coffee and maybe some salt.  Medium body with a tang.  Taste is chocolate, coffee bean and maple.  Delicious.  Wheres the bacon?

On draft at the Humeville Inn. Pours a dark maple cola with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, maple syrup, smoked bacon and malt. Taste is much the same as the aroma. Taste dominated by maple syrup and coffee.  Very nice.
Draft at woodys with vin. Pours deep brown body with thin brown lacing. Aroma is maple syrup and light roast. Mouthfeel is creamy with notes of chocolate, maple syrup, light roasted meat.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2012 I had this at the Florida Regional Brews Takeover at the Brass Tap in Wesley Chapel during Tampa Beer Week. I had heard about this beer for months and was a bit cynical, but once I had it, I can only describe it as a rare experience. This pour was perfectly balanced with smokiness and a gorgeous tint of Maple that was not overpowering. Its chocolate notes were very apparent but not out of check. Its coffee notes were like a rich espresso. This is a beer that is unique and truly worth experiencing. It illuminates many unique possibilities that creative brewing can yield.

From notes.  First reviewed 10/30/2011.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip. Thanks to paulmpapp for bringing this to our tasting.

The pour is a fairly dark mahogany color that does not maintain in the edges. The corners are slightly transparent brown and ruby. 

There is a nice amount of smoked malt that fills up the nose. Sweet maple syrup comes through next, with roast coffee coming through at the end. The nose lives up to what this is supposed to be.

The flavor is sweet up front, with true maple syrup and dark roasted malts. The smoke comes through right away, filling up my nose and resting on the tongue. The malt has a good dark and roasted character that leads well into the coffee bitterness toward the end. The finish has more malt, and some sweet maple lingers into the coffee bitterness at the end.

If anything, the body feels a little light compared to the body. The robust flavors deserve a fuller beer. The carbonation is on the light side, and there is a moderate sweet stickiness that sticks on the lips after each sip. Even with the sweetness, the coffee really brings a dry and slightly acrid feel to it.

This is a great beer; the only thing that could really make it better would be a little bit more carbonation and a bigger body. I am definitely excited to see what the imperial version has to offer.

Bottle with friends. Black appearance with a brown head. Sizzling, fresh bacon, rich maple, pancake syrup, campfire ashy aroma. Somewhat tangy, apple fruity, ashy, burnt smoky, meaty flavor. The aroma was heavenly but the flavor didnt live up to my expectations.

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lingering ringof tan foam. Aromof maple, bacon, coffee, light cocoa and light roastiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of ashes, maplke, cocoa, light coffee and a hint of bacon with a smooth dry ashy maple finish.

Sampled at FBG beerfest, poured a dark black color that looked very thin to be a porter.  However the aroma was a kick in the nose of black coffee, roasted malt and fresh bacon and smoke.  Flavor was roasted coffee, and a touch of bacon.  This beer was good, and well worth the mob to sort through to get to finally try it.

sample at Brewvival on 2/25/12. long line for this one - but worth it. light black pour with a 1+ finger off white head. no bacon on the nose. huge maple syrup nose with vanilla and coffee. amazing! med body with maple / coffee / chocolate and vanilla. smooth. sweet finish with chocolate and coffee. again no bacon.
Coffee, chocolate, and slight maple aroma. Maple syrup is the dominating flavor through the finish. Good, really interesting beer.

Draft at Brewvival. Pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of sweet roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee and roasted malts. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, maple, faint bacon notes and a roasty finish. Medium bodied.

Dont focus on the word bacon. I saw fistfights break out to get this beer only to see people be disappointed. Its a nice beer but I didnt pick up any bacon flavors. Maple, yes, very much . Would pour this on my pancake 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a pitch black, aroma is sweet and a bit pungent. Ok for beer extremists 
but pour me a Left Hand Milk Stout. Ugh.

Bottle shared at Haggertys Fantasy Tasting. Black in color with short tan head. Big time breakfast aromas. Coffee... maple... fetch me some pancakes and eggs please. Flavor profile matches the nose. Mmmm bacon. Finishes with dry dark chocolate. Great label. Thanks Matt.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 Growler @ The Bruery, shared by Sam. Black pour with a khaki head. Aroma lives up to the name. Smells like smokey bacon and maple syrup. Notes of vanilla, chocolate, and plenty of coffee and roasted malt. Lots of caramel, too. Flavor is slightly bitter, but has plenty of maple, vanilla, and caramel sweetness. Smoke, coffee, and bitter dark chocolate. Actually pretty good.

Thanks Paul for bringing thisrare treat to our Halloween whale tasting.  Deep brown in color, not much head on the pour.  Fantastic nose on this beer, great balance of maple and coffee roast.  The bacon/smoke is ever so subtle....really wish I could give this aroma 11/10 pts.  Taste deviates a little from the nose in that black coffee is the more prominent theme of the beer as opposed to the maple.  There is still plenty of rich maple syrup though and some hints of smoke.  Medium body with some astringency from the coffee.  Really solid beer!  I thought this was more hyped based, but it ended up being one of my favorite of the day.  I ended up cleaning the bottle a day or two later for display and was blown away by how strong the maple scent still was in the empty bottle.  Funky Buddha has a winner in this one.

fresh bottle courtesy of hopscotch, thanks a ton! this a great beer, no let down here. i liked this one better than the wide awake. very full and flavorful with a medium oily and rich body, the 6.3 makes this drinkable and very enjoyable. no cloying whatsoever, a slight bit of porter ffel in the finish, terrific stuff all the way around. smells amazing.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 It is everything I wanted in flavor and aroma. Aroma brings a ton of maple syrup at first, and then after settling for a bit a ton of smooth roasted coffee dominates. The balance of maple overtaking the smokiness of the bacon with the coffee coming in the middle was perfect on the flavor. There are delicious hazelnut creamy coffee notes as well. Poured dark black with decent tan head.

32oz Growler from ... the man himself, funkybuddha.  Shared 12-16-2010 with friends.

First off -- awesome growler. Slight but promising hiss when I open the top.  Pour is a deep brown, large bubbles from a vigorous pour mixing with a thin but dense head that rises up after it hits the glass. Aroma is an intense coffee with hints of brown sugar and smoke. Taste is terrific -- while still cold its a rich coffee with a chocolately finish and a touch of smoke. The maple comes out as it warms with a rich maple sugar element coming up in the finish and the coffee mellowing out to let some of the sweetness and just a touch of heat through. Mouthfeel is low carbonation (expected for the growler), but rich and verging on the edge of viscous. Supports the roasty coffee edge well. Smoke comes through more on the nose than on the tongue. When I finish the glass the aroma of maple and bacon persists... gotta clean this before moving on. Drinkability is phenomenal.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2012 Thanks to ericandersnavy......Pours a very deep brown with tan head. Aroma, is, WoW! Strong notes of bacon, dark roasted grain and maple....flavor is much the same with hints of chocolate and pretty intense. Mouth feel is medium body with low carbonation. Overall, outstanding brew!!!!
Pours really dark brown with a tan head. Has a maple and celery smell to it. Has an odd celery sweet maple taste. This one is just to odd for me.

Breakfast all day long!!! The aroma is smoky and sweet, not too much coffee. The coffee is more in the taste and combined with the maple, you cant stop drinking it. The body is syrupy and very dark. Make this beer, one of your last beer of the night. This taste will linger for a long time, which is great for people who love breakfast.

(Growler thanks to ericandersnavy) espresso brown pour with a dark tan head. Nose of sweet chocolate, rich coffee, vanilla, maple, Belgian waffles, super rich, smells SO GOOD!! Taste of rich coffee, maple, waffles, sweet chocolate. The body is slightly thin but a delicious coffee linger is here. Creamy in the finish and quite toasty. This is an excellent sweet stout!!

Poured from a sealed growler from a friend that got this sent to them from the FBL directly!!!!

Poured in a tasting tulip. pours a pitch black with minimal head. was poured pretty soft since it was a tasting glass.

the nose is amazing... light roasted coffee followed by a hint a sweetness and a tad of smoke.

the taste is amazing. all of the different aspects of the beer come through at different stages of the taste. First you get the coffee on the front/ initial taste. Then as it moves back in the mouth the maple sweetness takes over ( but not in an over powering way like a creme brulee) then after you swallow and breath a little but the smoke (savory bacon) hits the back of the throat!

This is one amazing beer for sure! Glad i was able to try it.

Funky Buddha maple bacon porter. Half gallon growler fill from Eric...  
Pours a dark stouty reddish brown pour with a minimal light tan  
head... Aroma is assertive with coffee, vanilla, and vivid maple  
notes... Flavors are much of the same with a smooth vanilla, roast,  
and lingering maple character that is delectable degree. Body is l
VHF to medium with a good deal of roast and semi-acrid touch . Nice.
9/4/8/4/17
Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of smoke, caramel and chocolate. About the same taste-wise. medium bodied and relatively smooth. Very interesting.

In short: The name says it all, and it is INTENSE.  And also inexplicably excellent.
How: 22oz bottle.  Early 2011 batch.  Hilarious label.  Consumed fresh approximately one week after it was bottled.  Bottle sent to me by hopscotch, thanks a lot Eric.
The look: Near black body topped by a persistent small beige head
In long: Intense nose (really INTENSE) that is like a grandma freshly baked sugar pie with your nose one inch away from the pie, a lot of maple syrup, a lot of smoked pull pork.  Oh man, I literally could smell my glass two feet away.  Not much of the advertised coffee on the nose though.  Taste follows suit with maple syrup, freshly baked homemade crusty sugar pie, smoked pork and then adds a sip of cold black coffee, notes of iced-tea, cigarette butt and a good amount of caramel fudge and chocolate fudge.  No hops presence whatsoever.  There is so much intense flavors to distract my palate that the sweetness didnt bother me at all.  Reading my description the beer sounds gross.  But in reality this was pretty damn good.  A successful exercise in excess.  This is an over-the-top beer that I wont soon forget, Im sure I would have a lot of great memories of beer if it didnt make me forget so much stuff.

look: 4  smell: 4.5  taste: 4.5  feel: 4.5   overall: 5

A- Pours a Dark brown color with a small tan head that dissapates quickly

S-WOW, the smell is great. Smeels of coffee. almost like a starbucks frappachino that you buy in those glass jars at gas station. You can smell the maple also. No bacon smell coming though. OVerall the smell is so delightful

T-Coffee flavor hits you right up front then the smooth maple comes in second then it finishs with a saltness. A saltness thats like cured meat. Which must be the bacon. 

M-Medium bodied, has a thick mouthfell

D- OVerall this is an outstanding porter, not too watered down like some and not too coffee flavored like others. And the savory saltness is something ive never tasted in a beer. The only complaint i have is i wish the bacon flavor was alittle more present, But overall this was an outstanding porter ad glad i was able to trade for it. IM proud thatthis beer could be my 100th Review. Please try and get this beer, u wont be dissapointed

22oz - Courtesy of Hopscotch.  Thanks for sharing, Eric!  Black, tan creamy head.  Bacon wrapped french toast aromas swirl on a warm buttery sweet maple syrup and coffee tone throughout.  A true breakfast lovers treat as flavors are tightly wound on notes of espresso, salty smoked bacon, and hints of Vermont maple candy.  Full bodied, soft carbonation, smoked maple finish.  Fantastic beer...

22oz bottle with a great label shared by iceicebaby, thanks Sean! As soon as this beer was uncapped I smelled its sweet smokey aroma. Pouring a dark, dark brown with a two finger tan head, its aroma consisted of sweet maple syrup, a bit of smoke, and TONS of deep roasted coffee. Taste was dark chocolate and multiple layers of deep roasted coffee. The finish was extra (nearly dry) dark chocolate with an almost chalky mouth feel with low carbonation and a slickness from a cold serving temp. A great "sweet stout" and I easily polished off 6 oz or more.

dark brown, thin cream ring. Heavy coffee nose with a lot of unfermented sugar, light chocolate. Flavor is heavy milk chocolate, light coffee, light a chocolate dessert from Baskin Robbins. GT said Duncancino, he would probably know. Thick, creamy body, lingering sweetness through the finish, masks any other base malt. They got the "sweet" part of "sweet stout" right.

22 Bottle shared by YGTBSM.  Highly pronounced smoky burnt bacon chocolate aroma.  Intensely flavored, but not so sticky or resinous.  Mellowed CO2.  Makes the Schlenkerla beers seem tame and mild.  Quite intense, the aroma is potent.  Intense flavor as well, but quite drinkable.  Maple syrup, burnt bacon tones dominate.  Completely unique, World Class beer.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 651mL handbottled from the brewery with official label. Picture coming soon! Big thanks to ygtbsm94 via hopscotch for the bottle. The pour is a clear cola brown with thin, tan bubbles. No real head formation. Nose is very intense sweet coffee, hazelnut, Dunkin Donuts dunkaccino. Very rich and robust. Taste is thinner, lemon, watery, full of astringent coffee that gets a little harsh. Definitely some interesting coffee used and bound to be a big hit if ever bottled. Would like to retry with more carbonation. 5/16/2011 8/3/6/3/14=3.4Flip-top, fresh growler thanks to NoSignsOfPain! Off the bat ridiculous nose. Huge Waffle House 6am aroma with an entire jug of Aunt Jemima. Taste actually delivers this time- awesome maple character with bitter coffee to balance. Nice palate with hop and coffee balance believe it or not. Drinkable, less sweet than you would imagine. Delivers. 12/16/2013 9/4/8/4/16=4.1

Bottle shared by cmonster. Pours black with a thin beige head and a maple and coffee aroma. Smells like breakfast and tastes like a delicious beer pancake with a chocolate finish. If you use your imagination, there is enough smoke and roasted malt to emulate bacon.  Very complex and tasty.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94: Pours a dark mahogany with a spotty-lacing off-white head.  Has an incredible strong smoky maple nose with some brown sugar sweetness.  Starts with pretty good fullness and chewy dark caramel sweetness before a drier roasty bitter balance and lots of lingering maple flavor in the finish.  A very unique and well-made brew.

22oz bottle, thanks ygtbsm94.  Small off-white head, cola-black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, strong maple, some coffee.  Taste is moderately sweet, maple, some mocha.  Medium-full body, fairly sticky.
Bottle courtesy of ygtbsm94, thanks!  Dark clear brownish maroon.  Aroma of maple syrup and burnt espresso.  Taste is like flat and very sweet chocolate soda.  Sweet.  Very sweet.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94.  Pours black with an average, bubbly off-white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (roast, coffee, toffee), no hops or esters, heavy maple, with subtle bacon.  Flavor is maple bacon and roast malt with wood notes.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation with a sweet finish.

Bottle, pours very black, slightly tan on the edges with off white head.  Aroma has big notes of maple, mocha, chocolate, coffee, some slight ash and smoke, charcoal notes even, with just a hint of medicinal.  Taste is delicious, with notes of coffee and maple in the forefront, slight smoke and char, ashes and almost a hint of cigarette butt, but very nice and sticky maple with some molasses, toffee.  Delicious, drinkable, and worth the hype.

Many thanks to Armin for bringing the bomber over!  Poured very deep brown, near black, with a creamy cap of dark tan head.. looked great in the glass!  The aroma picked up a whole heap of coffee and maple, and came across on the sweeter side.. a touch of smoke represented the bacon on the nose.. loved the coffee/maple interplay.  The flavor opened with syrupy maple and molasses, backed by a heavy dose of cold toddy.. maple surrounds and coats the mouth, leading to a long, sweet, warming finish.. bacon saltiness cut through the sweetness well.. very tasty stuff!  Medium-bodied on the palate with a slow-ish feel from the maple.. nice carbonation.. totally delicious stuff!

Special 22 oz bomber of the brew.  Can smell the coffee immediately from popping the top.

It pours into my pint glass a really dark brown with some lighter brown to even red highlights.  The head is gone pretty quickly.

The aroma is heavy on the coffee but there is a definite maple presence in the nose.

The taste is a lot of the same.  Coffee and tons of roasted malts but a very nice maple sweetness.  Slight hint of smoke in there as well.

The mouthfeel is great.  Full body and creamy.

For someone that doesnt like coffee I really enjoy this beer.

Bottle thanks to hopscotch. Last beer before my 32nd birthday. Wow, this one really lives up to the hype. Perfect nose of freshly brewed coffee, maple, roast chocolate malt, vanilla and a light smokiness. Taste is the same. Well balanced. I wish the bacon was more prominent, but I cant really complain as this is an exceptional beer.

Courtesy of northernbrews:  The aroma consists of maple syrup, burnt coffee, and light bacon.  The burnt coffee is a bit harsh.  It pours a dark brown with a minimal off-white that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass.  The flavor starts with maple syrup and a touch of chocolate.  There is a faint bacon flavor in the background.  The finish has an increased maple syrup presence and some burnt coffee grounds.  Overall the coffee is a tad harsh and burnt.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle, thanks Chris!! Pours dark brown, with a brown head. Aroma is crazy, maple, vanilla, coffee, smoke, roasted malt, and caramel. Flavor is maple, vanilla, roasted malt, and coffee. Nowhere near as sweet as I expected. What a unique beer!

Growler courtesy of Dosbeerigos. Thanks, Phil! Served in a snifter.

Pours a very dark brown with a nice tan head and a bit of spotty lacing. Thin collar as it goes down. Nose is quite incredible with large doses of vanilla, smoke, and coffee off the front end. As it warms up, the maple really starts to come out. Very, very nice. The flavor hits the same high notes with a good dosing of roast and coffee plus some maple. Not as much smokiness here. Mouthfeel is medium with a dry finish and moderate carbonation. Incredibly drinkable and we certainly had no problem finishing off this 32-ounce growler. Thanks again to Phil for the awesome hookup on this one.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 02-14-2011

Hand bottle courtesy of Eric, in his honor THIS BEER ROCKS.   Pours a near black body with a  creamy mocha cappuccino like head with great retention, and light lacing.   Aromatically a big soft coffee head, reminiscent of coffee bender.  Light chocolate malt tones, a touch of milk chocolate, very fresh coffee and light marshmallow.  Not much maple or smoke/bacon in the aroma.  Light vanilla sweetness, a hazy sweet straight out of the freezer coffee tones, with bacon wrapped in maple sweetness.  Coffee and cream like sweetness.  Finishes sweet with lactose sweetness and a lighter roast y coffee bitterness.  Solid offering.  Might be difficult to session a few of these b/c of the sweetness but that is really no fault of the beer.   I loved it.

Bomber thanks Hopscotch. Black pour with tan head. Aroma full of maple syrup, and coffee. Taste like liquidized maple syrup covered bacon with coffee, sweet throughout lots of maple, some lighter vanilla and chocolate tones.

Growler thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours with a deep near black body and a large and long lasting tan head with good lace. Aroma from afar of coffee and vanilla. Up close: huge roast and a ton of minerallity, smoke, delicate toffee, and artificial (aunt jemimas) maple syrup (fenugreek stuff). Basically smells like an IHOP. Flavor has a sweetness and mapleness that is hidden by the coffee in the aroma. Really nice sweetness. Huge flavors and complexity for 6.3%! Some coffee as well, nice bitter balance. A bit of lactose possibly too. Really tasty. Creamy carbonation. Really well done, might have to recreate this.

2nd tasting on tap at Hunaphu. Orignal score was 4.33, had to adjust up accordingly. Incredibly tastey and crushable. 

Big time thanks to Nate who was able to land this after I failed with several attempts. 32oz "Florida" growler into a Matilda tulip...A dark brown, almost black pour. A very light tan head rises about half a finger but stays with a great cap, ok lacing...The aroma is star of this beer. Huge notes of freshly ground coffee, slightly roasted, bold. The finish brings about wonderfully subtle maple syrup. The sweetness breaks the coffee up nicely. Most maple syrup is used heavy handily, this is done right. One would almost want more but it would really become to sweet in my opinion. Slightly smokey as well, but bothers me as I cant help but ask where is the bacon?...The taste is almost as good, but doesnt quite carry the weight on the nose. Coffee again is the main player, comes across more roasted now, but still freshly brewed. Sweet finish again, a hint of smoke. Basically, the nose, just not as good...Mouthfeel is ok, good carbonation, but the body is too light, not much of a finish...Easy to drink!

This is really good, and close to being world class. The name throws me the most and without the bacon reference I would have probably rated higher as going in I was expecting more smoke or some salty pork so I feel a little let down, if thats possible. I would certainly drink this again and recommend it highly. Just forget the name going in.

Draft at Cigar City, Hunahpu Day 2011.

Pours a deep dark chocolate brown color which is completely opaque with a one finger frothy micha headthat quickly settles into a lasting ring. Minimal spots of lacing left behind.

Wow, the aroma of this beer is ridiculous! Slightly roasty and smokey with a blast of chocolate/mocha/espresso. Not burnt or acrid smelling at all with lots of luscious chocolate, roasted espresso bean and sweet maple syrup. Kind of smells like a Southern Tier dessert beer.

Medium bodied with a smooth silky roasted chocolate mocha espresso flavor. Very well balanced with the perfect roasted character, sweet malt and maple. Thankfully the coffee presence is prominent without being overly acrid or tasting like used coffee grinds. Lots of silky, luscious milk and bittersweet chocolate flavor as well as some slight smokiness and sweet maple. With bacon in the name I was expecting this beer to be more robust, smokey and burnt tasting but its just a touch and a very nice compliment to the sweeter flavors. No noticeable alcohol heat making this smooth beer very quaffable.

Overall, I was pretty impressed with this one. It doesnt quite live up to the extremely high scores its received so far but its pretty damn good. Even some folks who hate coffee beers were really into it

I have tasted this awesome brew more than a few times and Im blown away everytime I try it. It pours a dark brown. This thing smells just like breakfast in a bottle.Flavor is all bacon, coffee, and of course delicious maple syrup. If I could ever think of a perfect breakfast beer this would be it. Awesome job goes out to Ryan and the guys at FB.

Dark brown pour.  Aroma?  yeah its all in the name.  Flavor has more maple, coffee and pancakes than bacon, but its delicious.  Was the perfect beer to drink in the AM at hunahpus day! Bravo Ryan and crew at FB!
Pours a nice thick black with a tan head. aroma is maple syrup, coffee, and a bit of bacon. taste is maple syrup, nuts, coffee, caramel. very nice. very drinkable. overall a fantastic brew.
OMG! Coffee Bacon Pancakes! On tap at Hunahpu 2011. This was breaking amazing. I want more! A lot more! So much! Like liquid breakfast.... how did I only survive on a 3oz pour...

Appearance: clean thin smoky woody mahogany hues. Khaki head. Swirls with some nice puffs, fading into a thin film with a smidge of lingering lace.

Nose: iced coffee. Roasted, then dry and crumbly  instant coffee never smelled so good. Fudgy underneath with bricks of pure black cacao laden chunks. Intense. Coffee ice cream. Concentrated maple syrup, cold if you please. Smoky in the back with an oily bacony essence.

Palate: interesting and weird all at the same time; different than the nose. Iced instant coffee spirals into black fudge into oily smoky meaty greasy bacon. Dries mouth from first quaff to last. Applewood smoked bacon slathered in maple. Dark pitted fruits underneath  prunes. Smoke weaves in and out. Grows a tart meaty lactic tang in the middle, subtle and faint. Maple coats everything.

Final Thoughts: Im on the fence with this one strictly because Im not a huge maple fan. But for being a maple bacon coffee porter, it is spot on. Forget the brunch buffet and just grab yourself a glass.

Growler with HUGE thanks to ericandersnavy! I freaken love coffee beers! Pours a murky brownish red color with a foamy tan head. Lovely freaken aroma! Huge coffee notes with roasted malts, dark chocolate and the coffee aisle in wal-mart. Amazing. I cant stop smelling it. Big burnt, black coffee with a maple sugar flavor and a hint of bacon smoke. Man this is gorgeous! Syrupy finish with sweet memories of 2 AM Waffle House visits.

(Growler, courtesy of ericandersnavy)  Pours an opaque black body with a small tan head.  Aroma of coffee, smoke, maple syrup, and Belgian waffles.  Flavor of maple syrup, coffee, roasted malt, Belgian waffles, powdered sugar, smoke, and lactose.  Interesting and tasty.

Handbottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Black - light brown head. Roasted, coffee, smpkey, bacon, peppermint notes, fruity, licorice, light acid, sweetness, brown sugar, cocoa, chocolate, syrup, lots of coffee. Very nice.
Crowler, dufter sindsygt dejligt af kaffe, helt sort med mørke brunt skum, smager lækkert af kaffe, dejlig fylde monster meget kaffe ! Dejlig eftersmag meget kaffe!i ialt en super lækker porter !

Handbottled from tap.
Black coloured with a small beige ehad.
Roasted aroma of coffee, freshgrinded coffee and maple syrup.
Roasted flavour of coffee, mapele syrup and freshgrinded coffee.
Roasted finish.
Bottled. Black coloured with a reddish gleam. aroma of sweetness, cocoa, chocolate, spice. flavour of sweetness, chocolate, vague cocoa, medium to full bodied. Sweetish and coconut end.

Growler. Courtesy of Plovmand. Pours an opaque dark brown with a small beige head. Strange nose of herbs and vegetables. Medium body, hard roast malts, spices and minerals with a salty, metallic touch. Ends with a little burned malt astringency. 130211

Growler. Pours hazy dark to black brown with a small tan head. Aroma is solid herbal coffee and dark roasted malty. Thick dark chocolate and dark roasted malty and mild acidic flavoured. Bitter and dark roasted finish.

Bottle acquired via trade with darkguardian...thanks, my friend!!!  Shared this with family during the Super Bowl and my dad and brother-in-law talked about it about as much as the game!!!  Extremely fragrant aroma that filled the air with pungent Mrs. Butterworth maple syrup, freshly brewed Starbucks coffee, vanilla, and Nestle Quik.  Flavor is robust with pounds of Godiva chocolate, dark molasses, sweet toffee, and maple syrup-topped Belgian waffles.  Very reminiscent of Sees Candies Bordeauxs (milk chocolate filled maple bar with sprinkles).  Rich and creamy.  Was shocked to find this one weighing in at only 6.3% ABV.  Usually hard to pack that level of flavor and complexity into a smaller package.  So well done!!!

From growler, huge thanks to señor Plovmand. Black colour, light brown medium creamish head. Lots of chocolate and coffee in the aroma along with roasted malt, some smoke and dark fruit. Good filling mouthfeel. Very pleasant sweet flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, bit smoke. Long lasting roasted maltiness chocolate finish. Great brew indeed!

Thanks to Beerlando for the growler pour. Pours thick reddish black with a thick creamy head. Huge maple aroma, coffee and beefy bacon. Taste is smooth chocolate, maple and some coffee. Really complex and tasty, a real winner.
Dark pour with a thin beige head.  Aroma is cured meat, coffee, and roast.  MApel upfront with a healthly dose of coffee and smoke.  Dry lingering smokey maple-y finish very nice

Tap. Heavy coffee and molasses aromas for the malt, light resin for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast with cola, tobacco, a big hit of maple syrup and lots of dark dried fruit in the background.  Head is large, creamy, tan with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is almost black. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic, and lightly to moderately bitter.  Palate is on the fuller side of medium, creamy with a lively carbonation and finishes a little dry. An interesting  Sweet Stout with plenty of good attributes but the large amount of maple syrup blows it all away.

shared by plovmand.
clear dark brown, smooth brown head.
coffee, sweet chocolate notes, roasted stuff.
flavor is chocolate, cofee, tobacco, sort of flowery taste (salt?),

Growler provided by Hopscotch. You fucking rule man! It pours black with a creamy dense light tan head. The aroma is heavy coffee, light smoke, dark fruit, cookies, chocolate and vanilla. Very nice! The flavour is very bitter coffee almost espresso like, chocolate, hops and roasted malts. Very nice brew!

UPDATED: APR 8, 2011 On tap at the Jupiter Beerfest.  A big tip of the cap to Ryan and Kevin.  This was the biggest draw at the event.  In fact the mob was actually chanting maple!!  bacon!!  Mohago pour with very little head.  Outrageous maple nose.  A little thin in the body, but the taste is fantastic with maple syrup, caramel malt, sweet coffee, and vanilla dominating the palate...
1/15/11.  Growler thanks to Justin.  Sweet molasses aroma loaded with coffee... Lots of coffee!  Sweet coffee flavor with big maple syrup and a hint of saltiness.  Very maple flavor, but very nice.

Tasted at the big SeaBass has got to go tasting courtesy of jdubFL. The growler pours mahogany with tan head. The aroma is nice and yum with rich coffee and a little bit of vanilla mixing with roasted to dark roasted malts. The taste is thin but rich with coffee, burnt malts, maple, more coffee and toward caramel maple syrup. It is almost tart with the degree and level of dark to burnt malts and coffee that are attained.

Thanks to hopscotch for bringing this one to the So Long Sea Bass Tasting.  Pours dark brown with a white head.  Nose is chocolate, maple, smoke, some roast, and slight coffee.  Flavor is similar with a balanced blend of all the promised flavors.  Very well done.  Would love to try this without the smokiness of the bacon.

Thanks to Hopscotch for sharing the growler.  This is awesome.  I always award extra points for originality, and this has it.  Smokey bacon, sweet maple and a little coffee.  Everything is in the there perfectly.  I wish I could find a fault in this, but I cant.  Excellent brew.

Growler @ Seabass going away party, Jan15th 11. Courtesy of jdubfl.
Que dire de cette bière? tout simplement fantastique et reste une des meilleures de la nuit, loin devant certains grands noms de cette soirée.
De couleur brune foncée, léger col beige.
Arôme est fantastique, café est partout donnant des notes de moka, café au lait, malt grillé à souhait. Sans oublier le sirop dérable qui est appréciable.
En bouche, chacunes des gorgées donnent quasi une forme orgasmique à cette bière.  Tout y est subtilement bien arrangé, allant du sirop dérable qui est bien plus présent, le bacon donne une fine note de fumé, et de café. Je nai pas non plus noté le thé qui est utiliser dans cette bière.
Jarrête là car il est difficile de faire justice à cette bière simplement avec cette description. Je suggère donc de la déguster.

Seule bémol, je nai pas trouver trop de présence du bacon. Ceci étant dit, cette bière demeure une perle de dégustation venant de cette nouvelle micro-brasserie en Floride.

@Rudolph Throwdown-thanks to hopscotch-growler-pours a light brown head and black color.  Aroma is coffee grounds/roasty-dark malt, sweet maple.  Taste is coffee grounds/chocolate/roasty-dark malt, sweet maple, secondary earthy hops bite.  Lots going on.  Full body.  Not my style but tasty.

Growler from Dosbeerigos. Poured a darkish brown almost black with tiny white head. Aroma was maple syrup and roasted coffee. Taste was coffee and pancakes with maple syrup followed by a mild roastiness. Nice body. This stuff was amazingly delicious. Thanks for sending to me!

Growler shared by JoeTheYounger. Rating #7. Another very dark brown porter, really pretty to look at. Big ashy coffee aroma, very roasty and it socks you right on the nose in a very pleasant way though. Nice light sweetness, maple is there for sure, but just as a nice compliment to everything else going on in there. Nice roasted flavor as well and maybe a hint of chocolate. (1439)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Growler thanks to JoeTheYounger... Black pour with a thin light brown head....Aroma is awesome. Fresh ground coffee and maple syrup..Flavor is roasty. Dont really pick up any bacon...Tasty

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2010 Brown to black with a fluffy tan head.  Huge coffee aroma with caramel, maple syrup and maybe a hint of smoke.  Texture is plump and oily.  Tons of roasted coffee, with vannila and maple sweetness.  I couldnt find any bacon in here but thats quite alright.  I like this better than the regular espresso porter, well done.

On draft at Funky Buddha for a small get together/tasting. Thanks to Kevin for pouring us some  of this. What an amazing beer!! It reminded me a lot of coffee ice cream I use to  have as a kid. It had a large amount of coffee and maple flavor mixed in with a wee bit of bacon. I also got a good amount of dark chocolate as well. I could definitely wake up in the morning and pour some of this. Great job Funky Buddha!!

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2010 (Updated rating)... This beer rocks!... The second batch has more maple syrup and smoky bacon in the flavor. The nose is even more luxuriant. Very nice tweaks, guys! World class coffee porter!


(Original rating = 3.9) Draft South Florida Throwdown 2010  Muddy, dark brown ale with a small, creamy, off-white head. Decent retention. The nose is a fusion of Cuban espresso, maple syrup and dark chocolate with a whisper of smoke. Medium to full-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor presents sweet and acrid espresso up front; mocha and light acidity on the backside. Coarse, mocha, dry finish. Sample provided by hankchinaski!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2011 I had this beer courtesy of Kevin from the Funky Buddha, at the tasting I went to on Sunday. This was an experimental batch of the Piiti Porter. The beer was aged on a breakfast coffee that has hints of Bacon, Maple Syrup, and Strong Coffee.
Now I love the standard Piiti Porter, but hot damn this beer is amazing! Honestly, if breakfast in a beer is possible, I think it has finally been accomplished. The guys at the Funky buddha brought home the bacon (pun intended) with this beer.
The upfront taste was one of a standard coffee porter, then the maple syrup flavor comes in, and the leads back to coffee on the finish. Looking for the bacon was a challenge, and it mainly comes across in the nose.
Simply put, This is what breakfast beers should be!

If you are in the area jump on this soon, as from what I understand there is about 10 gallons total. Depending on the response they will brew it again. I have my fingers crossed that they do brew it again!

Pours a near black with a small tan head. Nose is tons of maple syrup and nice coffee grinds. Maybe a slight whiff of smoke but thats it for the "bacon". The flavor is by far the best version of the Piti that I have had. Full and rich up front with a huge amount of maple flavor and a nice full body finishing with light creamy roastiness. This coffee really worked well for this beer. A stellar brew by the Buddha.
